qas.question: What has since been considered in Kalinigrad?

answers.text: reverting Kaliningrad's name to its historic name of Königsberg

qas.question: What city was completely rebuilt after the Russians and Germans had bombed it?
How was the removal of the Germans in East Prussia usually handled by the Russians?
In what year was Konigsberg renamed as Kaliningrad?
What are examples of how the present Russian inhabitants of the Kaliningrad Oblast treatment of Germans?
In what year did the city centre of Kaliningrad start to be rebuilt?
In which year did  the present Russian inhabitants of the Kaliningrad Oblast start to emigrate there?

context: Although the 1945–1949 expulsion of Germans from the northern part of former East Prussia was often conducted in a <a2_0><b4_0>violent and aggressive<b4_0/><a2_0/> way by Soviet officials, the present Russian inhabitants of the Kaliningrad Oblast have much less animosity towards Germans. German names have been revived in commercial Russian trade and there is sometimes talk of <a0_0>reverting Kaliningrad's name to its historic name of Königsberg<a0_0/>. The city centre of <a1_0>Kaliningrad<a1_0/> was completely rebuilt, as British bombs in <b3_0>1944<b3_0/> and the Soviet siege in <b5_0><b6_0>1945<b6_0/><b5_0/> had left it in nothing but ruins.
